title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality told through the eyes of a child.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling prophecy about the future and a haunting tale of surveillance and totalitarianism.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel of manners, love, and misunderstanding.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins embarks on a journey to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about the events and misadventures in the life of a young man in 1950s America.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A novel about a young shepherd's journey to realize his personal legend.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about a man whose portrait ages while he remains young and beautiful.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel set in a technologically advanced future where humans are genetically bred and conditioned for their roles in society.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A novel about a future society where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic landscape.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young boy survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship and redemption that spans across decades and continents.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A novel set in Nazi Germany narrated by Death.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A love story between two teenagers who meet at a cancer support group.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A socially awkward woman develops feelings for a musician she has never met.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story and a mystery about a young girl who raises herself in the marshes of the South.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who stops speaking after committing a violent act.

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Foley
description: A wedding celebration on a remote Irish island turns deadly in this twisty mystery.

title: The Chain
author: Adrian McKinty
description: A mother is forced to kidnap another child to save her own in this relentless thriller.

title: The Institute
author: Stephen King
description: A group of children with special talents are taken to a mysterious institution where they are subjected to experiments.

title: The Outsider
author: Stephen King
description: A town is rocked by the gruesome murder of a local boy and the prime suspect is a well-liked teacher and little league coach.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil presence influences the father into violence.

title: Misery
author: Stephen King
description: A famous author is held captive by a psychotic fan after a car accident.

title: The Stand
author: Stephen King
description: After a pandemic kills 99% of the human population, the survivors face a new reality and a malevolent being.

title: The Dark Tower: The Gunslinger
author: Stephen King
description: The first book in Stephen King's epic series, following the last gunslinger as he pursues the man in black.

title: The Eye of the World
author: Robert Jordan
description: The first book in the Wheel of Time series, a tale of a young man's journey to save the world.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
description: The first novel in the Kingkiller Chronicle, telling the story of a young man who grows up to be a notorious magician.

title: Good Omens
author: Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett
description: The unlikely partnership between an angel and a demon to prevent the apocalypse.

title: American Gods
author: Neil Gaiman
description: A man is caught in a battle between the old gods of mythology and the new gods of modern society.

title: The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay
author: Michael Chabon
description: The story of two Jewish cousins before, during, and after World War II as they create a popular comic book hero.

title: The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao
author: Junot Díaz
description: A Dominican American boy's life is affected by the curse that has plagued his family for generations.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A magical competition between two young illusionists at a mysterious circus that appears only at night.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: A young boy's life is turned upside down after surviving an accident that kills his mother.

title: The Underground Railroad
author: Colson Whitehead
description: A young woman's desperate bid for freedom from slavery through the Underground Railroad.

title: The Overstory
author: Richard Powers
description: A sweeping, impassioned work of activism and resistance that connects the lives of a diverse cast of characters.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
description: A novel about the enduring bonds of friendship and the ways in which we are damaged by life and by each other.

title: The Luminaries
author: Eleanor Catton
description: A novel set in 1866 during the New Zealand gold rush, involving a young prospector and a series of mysterious events.

title: The Bone Clocks
author: David Mitchell
description: A narrative that spans decades and continents, following a young woman with a rare gift.

title: Cloud Atlas
author: David Mitchell
description: A novel composed of six interconnected stories that take the reader on a journey through time and space.

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A surreal tale of a Tokyo man’s quest to find his missing wife, which leads him into a bizarre alternate world.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A complex and surreal novel following a teenage boy and an aging man as their paths cross in unexpected ways.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A poignant story of one college student’s crush on an older woman, set against the backdrop of 1960s Tokyo.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A semi-autobiographical novel about a young woman's descent into mental illness.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society that treats women as property of the state.

title: The Testaments
author: Margaret Atwood
description: The sequel to The Handmaid's Tale, set fifteen years later.

title: The Road to Unfreedom
author: Timothy Snyder
description: A powerful analysis of the rise of authoritarianism in the world today.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of humankind's history from the Stone Age to the modern age.

author: Yuval Noah Harari

author: Yuval Noah Harari

title: The Body: A Guide for Occupants
author: Bill Bryson
description: A journey through the human body, exploring the mysteries of how we function.

title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
author: Bill Bryson
description: An exploration of the history of science and the universe.

author: William Strunk Jr. and E.B. White
description: A classic manual of the principles of English style and usage.

author: Stephen King

description: A course in discovering and recovering your creative self.

description: A step-by-step guide on writing and life.

description: A must-read for any writer or artist, this book identifies the enemy of creativity and shows how to defeat it.

description: A guide to being creative under pressure.
